parts.title: Regulatory Signs
parts.content: Regulatory signs dictate rules drivers must follow to prevent accidents.
details: How: Stop signs halt vehicles; speed limits control safe speeds
Logic: Following rules ensures predictable driving
parts.scenario: Ignoring a stop sign at a 4-way intersection can cause a collision.

quiz.question: What shape is a stop sign?

parts.title: Warning Signs
details: Why: Gives advance notice of dangers
parts.scenario: Ignoring a 'Curve Ahead' sign may result in losing control.

quiz.question: Why are warning signs usually yellow?
options: Because it is the most common color

parts.title: Guide Signs & Colors
details: Green = directions, Blue = services, Brown = recreation
Octagon = Stop, Triangle = Yield, Diamond = Warning
parts.scenario: A brown sign with a tent icon indicates a recreational area.

quiz.question: What does a green sign indicate?

parts.title: Traffic Scenarios
parts.scenario: Approaching a yield sign requires checking traffic.

quiz.question: At a yield sign you should:
options: Slow down or stop if needed
quiz.answer: Slow down or stop if needed

quiz.question: What is the main purpose of regulatory signs?
options: To enforce rules and ensure safety
quiz.answer: To enforce rules and ensure safety

parts.title: Speed Limits
parts.content: Speed limits define safe driving speeds.
details: Urban:25–35 mph, Rural:55 mph, Interstate:65–75 mph
Logic: Exceeding limits increases crash risk
parts.scenario: Driving 80 mph in a 65 mph zone reduces reaction time.

parts.title: Right-of-Way
parts.content: Rules for who goes first prevent collisions.
details: Yield to vehicles on your right
parts.scenario: Failing to yield to the car on your right can cause a crash.

quiz.question: Who has right-of-way if two vehicles arrive simultaneously?

parts.title: Passing Rules
details: Never pass on hills, curves, intersections
Logic: Avoid zones where visibility is limited
parts.scenario: Attempting to pass on a curve can cause a head-on collision.

quiz.question: Where is it unsafe to pass another vehicle?

parts.title: Traffic Scenarios
parts.scenario: Failing to yield when merging causes collisions.

quiz.question: At a merge lane, you should:
Why are passing rules important?
options: To avoid collisions on limited visibility roads
quiz.answer: To avoid collisions on limited visibility roads
